recipe_name: Pear, Brie and spinach salad with croûtons
author: Brian Turner
method: For the dressing, place all the ingredients in the bowl of a small food processor and process until smooth.  For the salad, place the spinach, red onion and pear into a bowl. Season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper and mix gently to combine. Drizzle the bread chunks with the olive oil and heat a frying pan until hot. Fry the bread until golden-brown on all sides. To serve, pile the salad onto a plate and scatter the croutons on top. Drizzle over the Brie and pear dressing and garnish with chopped fresh rosemary.
ingredients: 4 tbsp olive oil,  1 tbsp white wine vinegar,  1 tsp wholegrain mustard,  55g/2oz Brie, chopped,  ½ pear, chopped,  85g/3oz spinach,  ¼ red onion, sliced thinly,  ½ pear, cut into chunks,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  1 thick slice bread, crusts cut off, cut into chunks,  3 tbsp olive oil,  1 tbsp roughly chopped fresh rosemary, to serve
